Graph.description: The fundamental building block for creating stateful, multi-step applications in LangGraph
usage_examples:
graph = Graph()
graph.add_node('start', start_node_func)
graph.add_edge('start', 'process')
graph.set_entry_point('start')

StateGraph.description: A special type of graph that maintains state across nodes
usage_examples:
from langgraph.graph import StateGraph
workflow = StateGraph(MyState)
workflow.add_node('agent', call_model)
workflow.add_edge('agent', 'tools')

Node.description: A functional unit in a LangGraph that performs specific operations

State.description: Represents the state of the graph, containing information that persists across node executions

Edge.description: Connections between nodes in the graph that determine flow control

common_user_intents.make agents talk to each other: Create a StateGraph with nodes representing different agents and connect them with edges
common_user_intents.coordinate activities: Use conditional edges in a graph to coordinate activities based on state
common_user_intents.share information: Define a shared state schema that multiple nodes (agents) can read from and update
